intro: Adinandra crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved adinandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the rainy season. Adinandra crassifolia is typically found in lowland forests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
